dublinCore.title: 113 S1490 IS: To delay the application of the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act.
dublinCore.rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Flake (for himself, Ms. Ayotte, Mr. Scott, Mr. McConnell, Mr. Burr, Mr. Chambliss, and Mr. Coburn) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance

form.official-title: To delay the application of the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act.

section.header: Delay in application of Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act

paragraph.header: One-year delay in PPACA provisions scheduled to take effect on or after January 1, 2014
paragraph.text: Notwithstanding any other provision of law, any provision of (including any amendment made by) the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act ( Public Law 111–148 ) or of title I or subtitle B of title II of the Health Care and Education Reconciliation Act of 2011 (Public Law 111–152) that is otherwise scheduled to take effect on or after January 1, 2014, shall not take effect until the date that is one year after the date on which such provision would otherwise have been scheduled to take effect.

paragraph.header: One-year suspension of certain tax increases already in effect
paragraph.text: Notwithstanding any other provision of law, in the case of any tax which is imposed or increased by any provision of (including any amendment made by) the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act ( Public Law 111–148 ) or of title I or subtitle B of title II of the Health Care and Education Reconciliation Act of 2011 ( Public Law 111–152 ), if such tax or increase takes effect before January 1, 2014, such tax or increase shall not apply during the 1-year period beginning on such date.
